posts.author: samurainostalgique
posts.content:
Hello ecbguilders!

Here I am building yet another unarmed specialist, this time for Solarune, a relatively low magic (+3/+4 items are generally the best you can find, and I think there are no permahaste items) level 30 persistent world in which you start at level 10 (there is already a thread about this PW, but it just shows the subraces bonuses and maluses: fr-solarune-t2354562.html ).

I will be using the avariel elf subrace, which has the following bonuses:

Favored Class: Cleric
Properties:
Ability Bonus: Dexterity +2
Ability Bonus: Intelligence +2
Ability Bonus: Wisdom +2
Skill Bonus: Spot +2

In this PW, the subraces bonuses and maluses are applied like magic buffs and debuffs on top of the race's normal modifiers and feats. So, for example, an avariel gets all the usual elven traits, including +2 dexterity, and on top of that gets a further +2 dexterity bonus that counts toward the magic bonus cap, and doesn't count when trying to qualify for feats (as well of course as similar bonuses to wisdom, intelligence and spot, as seen above).

 
I was thinking about going with this:

There is an XP penalty from level 17 onwards, but I'll deal with it.

I reckon that this guy is tight on skill points and HP. In fact, I considered starting at 18 dexterity, 12 constitution and 10 intelligence, and investing in spellcraft, or maybe spot (there are a lot of stealth users in this PW, but this is more of a PVP and roleplay concern whereas I think that spellcraft would be more useful against mobs), using an epic feat for great dexterity, instead of epic prowess, but losing one point of AB is a hard decision of course...

What do you think about it?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: How about Monk 17 Fighter 8 / SD 5? You could use the 2 added Fighter feats in epic levels for EWS and Armor Skin, freeing up a general feat for Great DEX, which would allow you to start with 18 DEX and still end with 26 DEX. The only downsides I see are 3 less Spell Resistance and a 50% Monk Speed bonus instead of 60%.

posts.author: samurainostalgique
posts.content: Well, it would also make me lose the perfect mind feat from monk 20, as well as empty body, which is nice when soloing since I can't cast improved invisibility. I kinda like the idea of perfect mind from an RP point of view, plus it's nice not to have to worry about getting caught by a mind affecting effect without clarity, or getting your clarity dispelled. The benefits from such a trade off are tempting, but I think I still prefer keeping perfect mind.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Yeah, it feels sad when you are so close to the two best special features for the Monk and you do not get them.

posts.author: samurainostalgique
posts.content:
So, what would you choose between having more HPs, fortitude and another full skill, and having one more point of AB (or maybe metal skin for 2 more points of AC)? I'm still torn about that choice lol.

Dev crit is allowed here by the way.
